content.description: Dihedral crack.
content.location: Just around the corner from Crimp Scampi.

content.description: Bouldery hanging start that eases onto a slab and finishes at the same anchor as Groovy.
content.location: Right of Groovy

content.description: This is a variation of Webster's Part (5.8+...one move wonder). For a consistent 5.6 grade, start at the arête and traverse to the WP first bolt. It's a jug fest to the top. This is the perfect beginners first lead climb.
content.location: In Fennel's guidebook, this route is located in Crimp Scampi area...though it's not the same wall. The wall is located to the left of the Crimp Scampi wall.

content.description: There is a challenging move off the ground. The rest of the route has large jugs. The guide book warns of loose rock just below the anchors.
content.location: The sport route located in between Guide's Corner (trad) and Poetry in Goshen (trad).  Just west of the Kid's Wall.

content.description: Tall dirty dihedral between a bunch of sport routes.
content.protection: Gear to bolted anchor (note that the latest guidebook indicates a tree anchor but this route now has a bolted anchor).
content.location: Between Paul's Redemption and Sin Nombre.

content.description: Climb the juggy, wide dihedral with a small tree growing on a ledge 1/3 of the way up.
content.protection: Lots of long slings. Wide gear if you want it. One bolt anchor.
content.location: Left of Cotton Candy, right of Summer Rain.

content.description: Supposedly has the smallest holds in the canyon. Conditions could make a difference on this one according to the guidebook.
content.location: Just left of Johnny Revelator

content.description: Difficult start give way to jugs allowing you to pull up on a ledge area 10 feet off the ground. This leads into a left-angling chimney taking you to the anchors.
content.protection: Bring a single rack up to a #3 Camalot. Fixed anchors.
content.location: In The Corridor.   Right of Perfect Hair Forever, left of Bearded Lady.

content.description: This is the second bolted face route right of Local Hebrew. Just follow the jugs to the top, nothing special.  Watch the backscratcher tree on the way down.
content.location: Near the right end of the North Forty, this route is in the little dihedral area just past Crimp Scampi.

content.description: Around the corner from Molt. Crux at top. WAsp in pocket at start.
content.location: To the right of Molt around the corner.

content.description: Climb a bouldery start on marginal crimps and pinches to an open hand shelf below another open hand shelf. The 11d is to the shelf.  A couple 10 moves on a side pull in the small virtical finger crack and then stand on the shelf for the first of many jugs to come.  The 5.8 jug haul to the top is fun and slightly overhung.
content.protection: 7 bolts with a long runner on the first. Two bolt anchor.
content.location: Epoxy bolt line between big top and green goblin.

content.description: Climb Towely but clip the bolts at the start by climbing the dihedral to the left (Clown Suit). Move right around the third bolt to finish up on Towely.
content.location: Towely

content.description: Overhanging route down low using eyebolts. Crux is between bolt one and two...us  dihedral crack to get started. Thn stay on the face for first clip.
content.protection: 4 bolts to fixed biner (1). Stick clip first high bolt or use big gear down low for first piece.
content.location: First route on the left of the Petrified Wall. Line goes directly up

content.description: Pull the start on Groovy but head straight up the face after clipping the first bolt on Groovy.
content.protection: 1 bolt then finger sized gear. Tree anchor at the top or step right to the Groovy bolted anchor.
content.location: Share the start with Groovy but head straight up.

content.description: Difficult jams in a flaring crack lead to a long move protected by a single bolt.
content.location: Directly left of Venus Butterfly

content.description: The right-facing dihedral on the right side of the main Kindergarten Boulder face. The easiest route at HCR. Another classic squeeze job, this is basically the same route as Class Clown.
content.protection: A hand-sized piece or two or a sling or two for chickenheads. Traverse right at the top to the bolted anchor on Class Clown.
content.location: Between Little Miss Giggles and Class Clown.

content.description: Another short, slightly dirty dihedral.
content.protection: Gear - you could probably place a #6, or bring a couple finger and hand size pieces. There is 1 bolt up and left at the top.
content.location: The dihedral to the right of Tres Equis.

content.description: Thin holds at the start leads to large holds and easier climbing to the anchors.
content.protection: Five bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Locate the first dihedral to the right of Crimp Scampi. Sundial is the third bolted line to the right of the dihedral. It is still in the same area with all the wooden benches, and there is a bench straight back from the route.

content.description: The start of the route is a very interesting thin crux which is followed by climbing that becomes gradually easier and finishes on jugs at the top.
content.protection: Six bolts to a two bolt fixed anchor.
content.location: Located to the right of a black dihedral (Dancing Bears) and to the left of The Greatest Show on Earth.  The North Forty trails comes close to an overhanging, undercut wall (Big Top is on that wall).  Follow the cliff uphill from the "Big Top Wall"  until the base of the cliff starts going downhill again.

content.description: Previously a trad route exclusively, this fun route can be climbed by gaining the low ledge and moving up the crescent flake.  Layback the flake and climb the face to the anchors.
content.protection: 6 bolts lead to a two bolt anchor
content.location: Locate the crescent-shaped flake about halfway up the wall, just right of The Greatest Show on Earth.

content.description: Easy, and fun climbing.
content.location: First bolted route to the left of The Season of the Storm and right of Scrambled Eggs.

content.description: Climb pockets at the start, then traverse right to a roof finish. Cleaning the route can be a challenge unless someones seconds the route on toprope.
content.location: Sour Girl is the sole route on the boulder at the end of the "road" while walking to the North Forty. It is on the right and right before you cross the dry stream bed.

content.description: The slightly overhanging crux comes in the first fifteen feet, then follow jugs to the top.
content.protection: Five bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Located on the far right hand side of the cliff.  It is just left of a large and wide dihedral (Groove Tube), which is left of a bouldering cave.
Kindergarten boulder.

content.description: Climb the easy slab and make the move into the roof holds, then enjoy the jugfest on the headwall.  Good fun.
content.location: Start from the narrow corridor, just to the left of Lavender Eye.

content.description: Start up the left side of a small roof and then follow the right side of the arete on jugs to the top.
content.location: Between Lampe Land and Roman Says.

content.description: Edges at the start give way to large jugs to the top.
content.location: Between Jewell Says and KatJac.

content.description: Start just left of a tree and follow black streaks to the top.
content.location: Between A Little Moore and Some Moore Better.

content.description: Same start as Horny Goatweed but go straight up into a left facing dihedral.
content.location: Between Horny Goatweed and Jackhole

content.description: Start at a tree and go up a brown streak to the top.
content.location: Between Something for E-Kat and Jewell Says.

content.description: Crux is around the 2nd bolt...pretty straighforward climb.
content.location: Left side of Crim Scampi wall between Adult Supervision and Mefloquine Dreams.

content.description: Clip 3 bolts on Summer Rain and head left into easy terrain to a short crack. Clip the last bolt of Summer Rain and finish on the left variation anchor.
content.location: Shares the start of Summer Rain and heads left

content.description: Short slab to large holds.
content.location: Between Some Moore Better and The Great Gracious Grant

content.description: Start right of the dihedral crack. Begin with a low crux then move into jugs to the top.
content.location: Continue right from Cotton Candy, around the corner a little ways. Just left of Count Chalkula.

content.description: Same start as Dancing Outlaw and same 9+ crux, but instead of following the permadraws and the face of the route, stay to the right of the arête. Continue all the way up on the right, shares same anchors as DO.
content.protection: Slings, gear to #2. You can sling a couple of big chicken heads.
content.location: Circus wall. Very far right route. Same start as Dancing Outlaw.

content.description: Basically a face climb in between two sport lines, this starts in a short crack and moves up jugs to the top.
content.protection: A couple finger or hand size pieces. There's a nice #2 vertical placement about halfway up. Share anchors with Girth Hitch at the top (step left).
content.location: Between Girth Hitch and Local Hebrew.

climbs.name: Shidded on Em aka Kneeling Before Power Extension

content.description: Add an extra number grade or two if you drink Steel Reserve before sending as it has "high gravity" and that increases the difficulty of the climb.  This is a linkup of Kneeling Before Power V10 and Zeke's Didge Dance.  You might be asking yourself, why does this exist?  And to that I would respond, why does anything exist? Nothing matters in life, but I'd argue if anything in the universe matters, it is this route.  So if you're lost in the sauce, searching for meaning in life, down on your luck, or just looking to have some fun?  Give this route a shot and I guarantee you'll find what you are looking for.  But for real, this climb is super cool.  Not many places offer the rare opportunity to climb a double digit boulder into a sport route.  So if you're bouldering V10, you can probably send 10b, which means that even if you have no stamina and no endurance you can still probably do this climb and tick a "hArD sPoRt RoUtE" for your troubles.  Climb Kneeling with a harness and draws if you're a real boy like Pinocchio.  Speaking of, if you're looking for a part of your body to grow as a result of a climb this is the route for you.  If you send Kneeling and don't do this extension, you're missing out. To those people, and very specifically my friend who didn't do the linkup:  too bad you'll never be rad.
content.location: From the campsite go down to the bridge that is too fuckin thin to get your crashpads through while also leaning as much as my the Tower of Pizza (this ain't no Pizza Hut and yes the misspelling was intentional don't come for me), walk through the open meadow while the dog barks at you even though he sees humans every day of his life, then walk into the forests and straight up a hill on a climbers trail up to the base of the cliff.  You'll see a fairly large roof and Kneeling starts in the very back of it.

content.description: Tricky crux around the third bolt. Route located right next to More Better.
Starts on big Horseshoe Jugs and then works up to the crux on the slab and then pull through to the top on jugs.
content.location: This route is to the left of Sonny Jim.

content.description: Overhanging start on small roof. Crux is down low, very bouldery. Jug haul after crux. You can either dyno at crux or do it static style. Permadraws all the way up, anchors at the top as of May 2018.
content.location: On the left side of the corridor area. It's the left most route on a wall with 4 routes. Route is located on a short wall left of the corridor.

content.description: Fun route on easy climbing.
content.location: Route just left of Spam.

content.description: Start up to gain a ledge and continue to the top.
content.location: Between Roman's Empire and Marek's Golden Way.

content.description: Starting in a shallow dihedral, move through some delicate moves before gaining jugs to the top of the wall.
content.location: Between Legacy and The Romaniac.

content.description: A nice line up the orange streak that starts with a small roof.
content.location: Between Something for Roman and A Little Moore.

content.description: (From new guidebook) Climb on small holds up low-angled rock to jug haul.  Finish on anchor of The Bulb.  (However, I recall it having it's own anchor when I climbed it last weekend.)
content.location: Sons of the Soil wall, route 94 in new book.

content.description: Start on a large flake and climb past a short crack and an overhang.  Finish on large holds to the anchor.
content.protection: Six bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: The climb to the left of Crimp Scampi.  On the right hand side of the bluff.  There is a bolted arete to the right (just to the right of Crimp Scampi).  Very popular and very chalked climb.

content.description: Obvious crack just to the right of Mossy Revelations which is the left angled dihedral.
content.location: North face of the Kindergarten Boulder, right side, obvious crack.

content.description: It's the overhanging offwidth that fors the Crimp Scampi wall. However, instead of climbing the offwidth ( this route, Poetry in Goshen Original is a 5.9), climb the face holds that form the dihedral.
content.location: The dihedral cave  on Crimp Scampi wall.

content.description: Starts on rightside of low roof. Starts on low angle rock and it transitions to jug haul.
content.protection: 5 bolts and anchors. Shares bolts with Newton County Mentality.
content.location: To the right of Newton County Mentality (the low roof) route in the Groovy area.

content.description: Start on right angled ramp. Route goes to the right, shares anchors with Narwal. Needs a little cleaning from more traffic.
content.location: Just right of Caught in the Closet Again

content.description: Get situated on the high starting holds, a small cluster of pockets, and power through the short overhanging crux. Most people will want to stickclip the first bolt. A few more moves of lesser difficulty get you over a bulge and out of the pumpy terrain. Fun and interesting jug pulling will take you to the top.
content.location: Somewhere between African Herbman and Crimp Scampi. There will likely be a pile of cheater stones at the base.

content.description: Start on a flake and head up a slab to larger holds to the top.
content.location: To the right of The Great Gracious Grant.

content.description: Face climb up Middle of Face. Step climb for the first 15 feet. Then move into some great holds Higher up. Great 5.7.
content.location: Located on a large boulder formation near the route "Bearded Lady". Only route on this boulder.

content.description: Start by clipping the first bolt on Frankenberry but continue straight up. At the second bolt pull over the roof using Wanted Man's holds(or avoid them for a 5.8+ variation) and continue with easy but runout terrain.
content.location: to the left of wanted man and right of Lion Tamer starting on Frankenberry

content.description: Start on lower angle rock to jugs to the top.
content.location: Between Jewell Always Smiles and E-Kat.

content.description: A short route of jugs.
content.location: Between Chica Bonito and Sonrisa Loco.

content.description: The crux of this climb is unmistakable, and very specialized.  Campus the first few moves to a large jug, then high step, crimp, and stand up into a shallow dihedral.  Follow good holds and much easier climbing to the arete and the top.  The bottom moves are much harder than the rest of the route, and can be made easier by using cheater stones.  This route will feel very different in difficulty to many different people.
content.protection: Six bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location: On the far right hand side of the cliff.  This route is on the right hand side of a bouldering cave, and starts with your hands above the cave.  Look for a shallow dihedral above some very chalked holds.

content.description: Fun short trad climb. Starts on an easy stemming dihedral leading into a fun but short finger crack that takes gear well. Look for the obvious dihedral at the top of the hill. No rap rings on the anchor.
content.protection: Finger size, smallest piece was a yellow alien and the largest was a BD .75 for the final moves.
content.location: Just to the right of Johnny Revelator

content.description: Offwidth to a chimney.  The crux is above the ledge around head height for another body length.  The constriction makes this a fun chimney problem.  If you are good at chimney problems, this will feel a lot easier.  You could face climb it, just placing protection in the inside, but what fun is that?
Start as Towley, but traverse on crimps and side pulls into the route Petrified. Overhanging route...good lumpy route. PG -13  safety if you don't stick clip.
content.location: Traversing route on Petrified Wall.

content.description: Left angling dihedral to the left of Poison Ivy crack with which it shares anchors.
content.location: Just to the left of Poison Ivy crack.

content.description: Cruise past two bolts to a pair of solid crimps.  Then set up for a surprisingly committing deadpoint to a left-hand jug on thin feet.  The rest is gravy!
content.location: This route shares a face with "Serfs and Lords," after you exit the corridor but before you get to the main wall where "Sonny Jim" and "Lavender Eye" sit.  It's the line on the left.

content.description: Starts in a 10 ft orange vertical crack, goes through a small bulge and spits you out onto slab climbing for 25-30 ft.  Fairly technical, unassuming, a fun route.
content.location: Located close to the far end of the north forty.  The 4th bolted route to the right of Local Hebrew.  There is a large flat sitting rock marking the spot of the climb.

content.description: Short dihedral crack that widens from thin fingers to offwidth.
content.protection: Cams/nuts with bolts at the top for anchors.
content.location: Far left of the North Forty.

content.description: A steep, technical face route that starts out on a kind of arete, moves into very overhanging moves and into a shallow dihedral.  You'll never talk to anyone who dislikes this route.  A hidden gem on the Ranch.
content.location: Located in the corridor area near Love Slave, Horny Goat Weed, Harry Butthole Potter, etc.  It is directly across the corridor from Horny Goat Weed.

content.description: Similar climb to it's neighbors. Line climbs left of Private Property.
content.location: In between Smooth Criminal and Private Propery on Crimp Scampi wall.

content.description: Pull up a gentle overhang on chickenheads and micro-jugs, with somewhat awkward body positioning.  Sustained with no particular crux.
content.location: This is one of the newer routes on the "Love Slave" wall to the left of the corridor.  It bears a plaque with its name and grade at the base of the route- otherwise I'd never have known what it was!

content.description: A V5ish boulder problem to jugs. The route starts with two flat crimp edges about 7' off the ground (cheater stones in place) with a huge foot out left and some ok options for your right. Reach out to some sidepulls up left and hit a jug. Traverse right about a meter and make a powerful move up to a huge horizontal beneath a roof (a pinch intermediate may be helpful). At the horizontal traverse the jug rail back left about 2 meters. An alternative option is to just dyno from the jug next to the permadraw all the way to the horizontal jug slot.  Finally reach up to the obvious flat shelf forming the roof. Climb about 15' up from their on victory jugs.
content.protection: 4 bolts to anchors.  Bolts 2 and 3 are fixed.  A stickclip for the first bolt is pretty mandatory as the technical crux starts at the ground and ends at the clipping jug for the second bolt
content.location: In between Seaana Says and Love Slave on the far left end of The North 40 area.  This is the third route to the left of the the steep arete forming the entrance to The Corridor.  Look for the pocketed stone protrusion about 15' up.

content.description: Short trad route on back side of Kindergarten boulder. Crack system goes through steep bulge, although there are huge jugs to pull the bulge.
content.protection: Trad...crack takes good pro. Hand size gear. There are now bolted anchors.
content.location: Backside of Kindergarten boulder

content.description: A linkup of Love Slave and Goldmember. Clip the first 2 bolts of Love Slave, then traverse right and finish on the upper half of Goldmember. A great way to climb the fun 5.11 upper crux of GM. Definitely harder than LS if you don't use the sit down rest on GM
content.location: The Corridor

content.description: Climbs 40 through steep jugs. Crux is a bouldery start.
content.location: Left and around the corner of Horny Goat Weed.

content.description: Quite a fun face route with thin climbing up to a bulge in which you pull to gain the anchors.  There is a plate about halfway up the route that is a little loose, stay off of it.   Someone rated it 5.10 at one point, but has been downgraded in new guidebook.  Agree with the new rating.
content.location: Located to the right of Girth Hitch.  In between Girth Hitch and a dihedral.

content.description: A low angled jugfest
content.protection: Slings for chickenheads, anchors at top
content.location: Route is on the Kindergarten boulders west face

content.description: This is the first bolted face route right of Local Hebrew.  Just follow the jugs to the top, nothing special.
content.location: Near the right end of the North Forty, this route is in the little dihedral area just past Crimp Scampi.

content.description: Start on a rail to the right of an arete on slightly overhanging rock.  Pull the crux that comes right off the ground and follow fun but easier climbing to the top.
content.protection: Seven bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: This is the first climb to the right of The Controversy and is found on the obvious arete that is found slightly uphill and to the right of Big Top and Corn Grinder.  Big Top and Corn Grinder are found on the colorful overhanging wall which the North Forty trail comes very close to.

content.description: Cool line on an arete.  Balancy right off the ground.  Goes steep at a couple points.
content.location: Located just to the right of Crimp Scampi near the middle of the north forty.

content.description: Shares a start with Crab Louse, moves right. Crimpy down low with technical moves and hustling body-positioning lead through an interesting crux. Some sharp holds here and there, route eases up in typical HCR fashion making it a bit soft for the grade and losing a star in the process.
content.location: On the west face of the Kindergarten boulder. Shared start with Crab Louse, but veering right.

content.description: Shares same start as MMM, but continue up and to the right, following PDs on the jug rail...
content.location: Front of the Corridor, shares start with Mine, Mine, Mine.

content.description: Easy climbing up the slab situates you below a roof boulder problem.  Clip the bolt above the roof and then move through the crux to jugs on the head wall.
content.location: Between Sonny Jim and Green Goblin.

content.description: Climb good edges to a ledge to jugs to the finish.
content.location: Just right of Emma's Got a Mullet and left of Something for Roman.

content.description: Start on Private Property...climbing the left leaning flake system. This used to be a trad route that protected nicely decently. After first bolt of Private Property, traverse over to Mefloquine's line. It's PG-13 rating because there is a potential decking on the traverse to the second bolt. May be a good idea to stick clip Mefloquine's second bolt if your not comfortable leading or traversing 5.9/5.10
content.location: Start on Private Property. Crimp Scampi wall.

content.description: Start on thin holds then follow jugs to the anchors.
content.protection: Four bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: The first route right of Around the Fur.  Located on the cliff uphill from where the trail diverges from the rough ranch road.  It is in the Corridor between the boulder and the cliff face.

content.description:
Lots of chicken heads, lots of no-hands rests, as is typical for the grade.  

  As the name implies it's not too reachy and great for kids (my 4 year old was excited to keep doing laps on it).
content.protection: Not a ton of good pro but you can sling chicken heads. There is a good crack 2/3 of the way up that will take a .3 camalot.  Anchors are bolted.
content.location: Just to the right of Sundial, not far from the practice rock behind.

content.description: Climb up broken vertical crack system up to large holds. Continue up the arete on very large holds.
content.protection: Gear up to #4. Protects really well. Has its own anchors and no longer needs to rap off trees.
content.location: To the right of Serfs and Lords, last route in the Venus Alcove.

content.description: Techy climbing with a brutal boulder problem around the 2nd bolt. Have not sent but thought this route deserves some recognition.
content.location: This area is between the circus wall and the corridor area. To the right of venus butterfly

content.description: Start on a slab and end on jugs.
content.location: Between Some Moore Better and Something for Jewell.

content.description: Traverse in slightly from the left to start at a jug and go up large holds.
content.protection: 3 bolts to anchor (shares anchor with Too Short for the Short Bus)
content.location: Between KatJac and Owen's Best Buddy.

content.description: The low crux comes right off the ground at a bulge and is followed by easier climbing to the anchors.
content.protection: Four bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location: The climb to the left of Around the Fur. The climb is located on the cliff face in the corridor between the cliff and a large boulder.  The boulder is found by walking uphill after exiting the road and starting on the trail to the North Forty.

content.description: Start on a few small edges and move up to the little roof.  Follow a crack until it runs out, then find a few cool side pulls and slopers near the top.
content.location: About fifteen feet left of "The Bulb"

content.description: A fun low-angled 5.7 with strange huecos for holds.
content.location: Just right of "Hangs a Little to the Left" 5.8 on the north face of the Kindergarten Boulder, downhill from Newton County Mentality.

content.description: A steep crux is followed by overhanging climbing on large holds.  There is one tricky move before the climbing becomes vertical again.
content.protection: Five bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location: After crossing the creek on the North Forty trail, head uphill.  Horny Goatweed is the first route to the right of the steep climb Love Slave.  Love Slave has fixed chain draws.

content.description: Challenging start to a jug-fest.
content.location: Left of Emma's got a mullet. Just right of cows in the mist.

content.description: The bottom starts with some technical and not obvious moves to a good break.  Climb on larger holds to the anchor.
content.protection: Five bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: This route is located in the corridor right that is uphill right after crossing the creek at the beginning of the trail to the North Forty.

content.description: A finger and hand crack that ends up with larger holds to the anchor.
content.location: In the Corridor, across from Harry Butthole Pussy Potter

climbs.name: Hangs a Little to the Left

content.description: The crux is stepping up on some relatively thin holds around the third bolt.  Getting on the route is also a little bit tricky.
content.location: Head down to the Kindergarten Boulder, just downhill from Newton County Mentality.  This route follows the line of bolts just right of the boulder's northeast arete.

content.description: An isolated dihedral left of the Crimp Scampi area.
content.location: Around the corner to the right of the Towley/Petrified area; to the left of the Crimp Scampi area.

content.description: Climb Render (V3) into Groovy. Not worth doing but a fun silly linkup on a gross day out.
content.location: Start on a block jug in the cave under Groovy

content.description: A high step right off the ground will be the crux for many people. Look for small holds at the first bolt and follow the line of bolts for progressively easier climbing to the top.
content.protection: Five bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Groovy starts on the left hand side of a bouldering cave. On the right hand side is Newton County Mentality.

content.description: Really cool offwidth/chimney crack in a dihedral.
content.protection: Up to a size six Camalot. Things get wide. It is possible to top rope off the anchors of Sons of the Soil, but careful with a small swing if you fall.

content.description: Start in a shallow dihedral and climb through a crux at about mid-route and finish on jugs to the top.  The climbing is somewhat sustained throughout.
content.protection: Nine bolts to a two bolt anchor. This route is equipped with parma-draws and a cllippable anchor.
content.location: After hiking the trail to the North Forty for a little while, one comes to a brightly colored, undercut and overhanging face.  This climb is to the left of the undercut/cave and starts in a shallow dihedral.

content.description: Possibly the best climb on a wall filled with good climbs.  The crux comes low, but the climbing remains interesting until the anchors.
content.protection: Five bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Located to the right of Strongman and uphill from the colorfull, undercut wall with several bolted climbs.  There is a large crack in a dihedral to the left of The Greatest Show on Earth.

content.description: Slab to jugs
content.location: In between Sin Nombre Moore and The Perfect Trifecta.

content.description:
Really overhanging route just right of Love Slave and left of Horny Goatweed at the corridor. Stick clip the first bolt and climb permadraws to the fixed anchor.  

  BETA: boulder the V5 start to the ledge, rest up, then climb a few more hard moves lead to a chickenhead finish. Getting a right heel hook on the same rail as your hands before clipping the 4th bolt is helpful
content.protection: Fixed climbtech permadraws all the way. Just bring a rope
content.location: Left end of the N40, just left of the arete/corner at the left entrance of the corridor formed by the bluff and giant boulder.

content.description: This is a steep jug haul route that has a black streak running down the middle of it.
content.location: Right around the corner from Crimp Scampi and Leonid.  Mid-North Forty.

content.description: The small roof midway up yields the crux. Near the top, the bolt line merges with Lion Tamer and uses its anchors.
Left facing dihedral crack right of Narwhal (the offwidth chimney route).
content.protection: Standard Rack, optional #4. There are now anchors up top.
content.location: Located in dihedral up the hill from Kindergarten boulder.

content.description:
This route offers both the crux of Fat Hand 5.12a and Big Top 5.11c

Crank out the crux start of Fat Hand until you get to the 2nd fixed draw, clip it, then traverse left to Big Top, clip the 3rd fixed draw on big top and climbed through the crux. Bring 3 quick draws with you.
content.location: Circus wall.

content.description: Great line up a great face.  Bouldery start leads to very enjoyable face climbing through a roof.  Find the fat handjam and it should all be over.  Too bad the last bit is slabby jugs, because the rest of the line is awesome.
content.protection: 8 bolts, 2 bolt anchor.  Most of these bolts are fixed and the anchor usually seems to have biners.
content.location: This is route between Big Top and Corn Grinder.

content.description: Link the Bottom of Fat Hand to the top of Corn Grinder.  The link is via a ~5 foot traverse across the obvious rail before the diheadral feature of Corn Grinder.
content.protection: Fixed draws for most of the route with anchors at the top.
content.location: Start of Fat Hand.

content.description: Moderate climbing. The start is the "pumpiest" move that can be easily protected with a #4. It now has its own anchor. If you want to make the route a bit longer, Traverse left to the A. H. anchor, if no one is on it :)
content.location: Start in the alcove by the arete, to the right of African Herbman. It now has its own anchor

content.description: The dihedral that Dos Hermanos starts in - continue up the dihedral to the top.
content.location: Between Dos Hermanos and Cows in the Mist.

content.description: This is a slabby dihedral with large holds and foot placements.  This is a great route for new leaders.
content.location: Third route to the left of the arete (Something for Roman). Left of tall boulder, Lampe Land and Something for Roman.

content.description: Wide dihedral to the left of Seanna Says.
content.location: The dihedral to the left of Seanna Says.

content.description: Climb the right angled ramp through the crux on the first bolt.
content.location: On the same face as Newton County Mentality. The right angled ramp gives it away.

content.description: Good holds through most of the route with super stable rest areas to place gear.  There is a single bolt at the crux.
content.protection: Mostly traditional. SR, maybe a #4 or #5 Camalot. Chains at the top.
content.location: This route follows the crack immediately to the left of Meck, Mecke ... What's the difference.

content.description: A tricky starting move on low angle rock leads to larger holds up to a shallow dihedral.
content.location: Between Owen's Best Buddy and Little Miss Giggles.

content.description: Needs Description

climbs.name: Dos Hermanos
climbs.fa: Clay Frisbie, Chad Churchill, Tony Balza

content.description: Climbs up a very juggy arete. Fun route. Start with chimney moves below and start up the jug haul. Fun route.
content.location: On obvious arete between two crack systems.

content.description: Well it's a chimney, and you could climb it if you wanted.  Probably best saved for a time when everything else in the area is mobbed with crowds.
content.protection: Unless you're comfortable running it out, a #6 camalot or equivalent is recommended.
content.location: The large vegetated chimney in the corner...

content.description: This is the steep juggy face just to the right of Corn Grinder, and converges with Corn Grinder for the last couple bolts.  The crux is probably straight off the ground, but this is a sustained bucket haul.  This line is great fun- it's long and feels very adventurous for a 5.9.
content.location: Just to the right of Corn Grinder.

content.description: Super easy face climbing left of the crack/dihedral.
content.protection:
Weird placements, size 2-4 cams worked out okay.

 2 Bolt Anchor
content.location: Black 4in dihedral left of Strongman.

content.description: Two cruxes and sustained 10 climbing make this route a must do on the North Forty.  Probably the best route of its grade at the Ranch!
content.location: On the right side of the North Forty, look for the crowd.

content.description: Short with no real rests, this route features good holds on steep ground that lead to the crux bit, having the goods for the finishing move. Be careful of the second clip, as blowing it with rope out would likely prove injurious.
content.location: On the steep, downhill edge of the Kindergarten Boulder.

content.description: Juggy holds and good clipping stances make this an excellent route for first-time leaders.
content.location: It is second route from the far right of The North Forty.

content.description: This is the bulging, jug-ridden face left of Dancing Bears. From the ground, locate the anchors and follow the path of least resistance and most protection to get them.  - FP guidebook
The crux comes low at an overhanging section and is followed by much easier climbing to the top.
content.protection: Five bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: After walking along the North Forty trail for awile, you will come to an overhanging, colorful, and undercut wall.  Go uphill from this wall (Big Top is on this overhanging wall) past two dihedrals.  Count Chalkula is the first bolted climb to the right of the second dihedral.

content.description: Long face route with plentiful chickenheads.  Perfect beginner route.  Color of the rock is gray at start but moves to beautiful orange near up top.
content.location: It is located in between Summer Rain and The Controversy.

content.description: Stick Clip the first perma draw on Corn Grinder free and boink up. Awesome moves on good rock through a dihedral makes for the crux. Typical North Forty top sections that is lower angle and full of chicken heads.
content.protection: All perma draws and perma draw anchors.
content.location: Last route on the Circus Wall over the cave. The start is from the first perma draw on Corn Grinder Free.

content.description:
Starts on a boulder, right of Fat Hand.  Boulder problem involving a dynamic move up and right on tiny holds leads past the first bolt to easier climbing.  This section can be aided by pulling on the bolt, making the route 11b A0. 

  The dihedral above is the 11 crux, with easier climbing above to the anchors.
content.location: This is the farthest right route on the wall just right of the Lavender Eye wall.

content.description: Start up some overhanging rock then move out right to the arete.  The route finishes at a two bolt anchor left of the arete.
content.protection: Seven bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location: The trail to the North Forty comes close to the cliff at an overhanging section which holds several 5.11 to 5.12 lines (Big Top etc.).  The Controversy is right of these climbs and a little uphill, past a dihedral, and starts to the left of an arete.

content.description: Short wide crack. Traverse left for belay tree or traverse right to use Towley anchors.
content.location: Dihedral with wide crack. To the right and up from African Herbman.

content.description: Easy jug haul up less than vertical face.
content.protection: Slings for chicken heads, bolted anchors.
content.location: Directly right of Little Miss Giggles on Kindergarten boulder.

content.description: Crux down low, then finishes on jugs and chicken heads.
content.protection: Small stuff. Nuts. Slings. Placed a few micro wires but slotting nuts and girth hitching slings will do the trick. Share anchors with African Herbman.
content.location: To the left of African Herbman. They share the same anchors.

content.description: Short and slightly overhanging. Climb the sharp chickenheads to the shared anchors.
content.location: On the East side of the Kindergarten Boulder.

content.description: Another short route with large holds to the top.
content.protection: 2 bolts to anchor (shares anchor with Chica Bonito)
content.location: Just left of Chico Bonito and just right of the arete.

content.description: Start just under a small flake and continue straight up the wall. Bolted as a tribute of the first ascentionists' brother, Paul.
content.protection: five bolts to a two bolt anchor
content.location: To the right of "Brand New"

content.description: The start is overhung but has a few big holds. Finish and rap on Earl's revenge anchors. Top is hard to protect but easy climbing to anchors.
content.protection: Small rack .25 - .75 and a set of stoppers
content.location: between Earl's revenge and lost rack. Follow the crack system to a small roof and over the large flake moving up and right to finish on the anchors of earls revenge.​​​

content.description: A hybrid boulder/route linking the V7 boulder problem "Butt Plug" straight into the bouldery start and moderate finish of Fat Hand 12a for 12d/13a pump. The hardest challenge on the wall if you've done everything else.
content.location: Sit start to Fat Hand, popular 12a in the middle of the Circus Wall.

content.description: Start on a flake and good holds to some side-pulls for the low crux.  After figuring out how to utilize the side-pulls, continue on big holds and fun climbing to the top.  A very enjoyable climb.
content.protection: Five bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location: This route is located on the right hand side of the North Forty.  It is fifteen feet left of a wide dihedral (Groove Tube), which is left of a large roof/cave.  The cave contains some bouldering and a lot of chalk.

content.description: This is another fun, easy/moderate face climb at The North Forty.  The crux is getting to the second bolt.
content.location: Located near the right end of The North Forty, just right of Newton County Mentality.

content.description: Start with some tricky climbing down low, then head right to a small roof and the "Dinner Plate".  The crux comes right after the dinner plate up black holds.
content.protection: Seven bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location: After walking down the North Forty trail for a little ways, one comes to an undercut, colorful and overhanging wall.  Big top goes up one of the overhanging sections of this wall and shares a start with Trapeze Artist.

content.description:
Connect the start of Big Top with the finish of Fat Hand. 

 Start on Big Top and climb up to and clip the 3rd fixed draw, then traverse right to fat hand, clip the 4th fixed draw on Fat hand or run it out in order to decrease rope drag and clip the 5th fixed draw on Fat hand then proceed toward the finish.
content.location: Circus wall

content.description: Longest route on circus wall. Start on Big Top and clip first 2 bolts, traverse right to Fat Hand and clip 3rd fixed draw on Fat Hand pull the bulge, traverse right to Corn Grinder below the dihedral and clip the 4th fixed draw then continue climbing.
content.location: Circus wall

content.description: Climb up the dihedral to the base of the roof, plug gear and fire crux moves through the thin fingers/lieback dihedral to your next piece. Follow easier terrain up and right to bolted anchors shared with Tattooed Lady.
content.location: The arete between Perfect Hair Forever and Tattooed Lady Direct.

content.description: A bouldery start with a left leaning lieback leads to a roof and then easier climbing to the chains
Start the same as Uncle Grandfather but veer right halfway up and follow jugs up and right.
content.protection: Tree anchor (or traverse left at top to use anchor on Uncle Grandfather)
content.location: Shares start with Uncle Grandfather and veers right

content.description: Climb up to the right side of a tree which connects this route with the boulder behind it. Fun climbing at the bottom is followed by an interesting crux by the tree.  Some use the tree, but the climbing is arguably more interesting without.
content.protection: Four bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Keep heading uphill from where the trail crosses a small and sometimes dry stream right after it diverges from the rough ranch road.  The route is located on the cliff face in the corridor between the large boulder and the cliff.  Follow the line of bolts to the right of the tree branch which touches the rock.

content.description: The climbing stays to the left of the arete and goes up good holds with some interesting moves down low, and finishes on jugs to the anchors.  Interesting climbing.
content.protection: Six bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: This route is to the right and uphill of the Big Top cliff, which is a undercut and overhanging wall.  On the left side of the wall which holds African Herbman, one can also find Srongman.  Strongman goes up a colorfull streak on the left hand side of the wall, and Strongman is just to the right of a slightly larger than fist size crack in a dihedral.

content.description: Starts on real easy terrain, get into small alcove, clip the bolt...crank up through crux to good holds.
content.location: Left most route on Crimp Scampi wall.

content.description:
This new route starts on Green Goblin and then veers right.  Traverse on big ledges right, to the brief crux section, leaning off a wonderful sidepull rail and stepping up to more jugs.  The rest is simple but still fun. 

  The consensus rating seems to be 5.10a right now, but it felt easier to me than its nearby neighbor First Normal Form 5.9+.
content.location: Start on Green Goblin 5.8, but follow the right bolt line.

content.description: A dirty line with sparse pro - climb up a faint crack/dihedral system to the right of The Hurricane.
content.protection: Sparse protection - there's a good place for a #1 in a horizontal about 10-15 feet off the ground. There is one tough move above this piece and then it is very easy to the top. Bolted anchor.
content.location: Between The Hurricane and Mossy Revelations.

content.description: Go through a low roof until you reach an orange streak with large holds.
content.location: Between Roman Says and Something for E-Kat.

content.description: A reachy crux at the first bolt, followed by a slabby 5.6-ish arete to the top-out anchors.  Fun and relaxing.
content.location: This route goes up the northwest arete of the Kindergarten Boulder, just downhill from Newton County Mentality.  It's marked by a small roof (crux) at the height of the first bolt.

content.description: The Forty wall is full of mainly sport routes with some trad here and there. It is easy to get to and has routes from 5.6 to 5.12c. It's not the tallest wall on the ranch (as short as 35 feet in some places) but has plenty of routes to make up for it. The average climb takes 6 draws plus 2 for the anchors.
